div.p: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Codes are from NCI

description.value: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Codes are from NCI

display.value: ANTERIOR Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.
APICAL Relating to or located at the apex.
BASAL Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.
CAUDAL Toward the tail in a body.
CENTRAL A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.
CRANIAL Toward the head in a body.
DEEP Extending relatively far inward.
DISTAL Situated farthest from a point of reference.
DORSAL Pertaining to the back or upper surface of the body.
DORSOLATERAL Toward the back and side of a body.
FORE Of or involving the front of a main body.
HIND Of or involving the back of a main body.
INFERIOR Pertaining to a point below a given reference point.
INNER Inside or closer to the inside of the body or object.
INTERMEDIATE Located between two points or extremes.
LOWER The bottom one of two.
MEDIAL Toward the middle or in a limb toward the median plane.
MIDLINE A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).
NASAL Of, or related to, or in the direction of the nose.
OUTER Being on or toward the outside of the body or object.
PERIPHERAL On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary;the outer area.
POSTERIOR Denoting the back portion of the body or a structure.
ROSTRAL Toward the muzzle in the head.
SUPERFICIAL Of or pertaining to the exterior surface.
SUPERIOR Pertaining to a point above a given reference point.
SURFACE The extended two-dimensional outer layer or area of a three-dimensional object.
TEMPORAL Of, or related to, anatomic sites that are located in the cranium, brain, and eye.
TIP The pointed end of a structure.
UPPER The top one of two.
VENTRAL Pertaining to the front or lower surface of the body.
VENTROLATERAL Of or pertaining to the front and side of a main body.
